title: Actually do something about players behavior
body:
Please, for the love of god can we actually get a working system that actually bans people. I am tired of having games with the same bloody people over and over again that do nothing but abuse and feed cause they find it quite amusing and they know nothing will happen to them. There is a small amount of people on the OCE that are trying to do the right thing. That try and not be salty, try and work together as a team but the majority of the people on this server make that very very difficult. There is only so many times someone can take the crap from other people until the snap back and then it seems that it is the people that have been trying to do the right thing get banned and punished rather than the people that have been abusing people for far longer. I had had games where I know someone has been reported by 4+ people. but then I will see him 2 days later, doing exactly the same thing, getting reported again, and he is back at it again several days later with no punishment. 

In nearly 650 games I have only had about 15/20 games where there has been no abuse, no racism, no sexism and it has honestly gotten to the point that I have lost all want to play this game, all the abuse and crap I cop from other people just is not worth the tiny bit of enjoyment I get out of it. 

There is going to be a hell of a lot more people that are going to leave this community and give up on this game if the company does not set in place some really strict rules, follow through with said rules and actually punish the people causing the same problems repeatedly not the people who overall are trying to do the right damn thing.

> Please, for the love of god can we actually get a working system that actually bans people.

You mean like reporting? Or leavebuster? Or support tickets? Or tribunal (which is currently in the works to be made more efficient)?

> I am tired of having games with the same bloody people over and over again

By taking a look at your match history one can easily see this is a false statement as you don't encounter the same people across games.

> abuse and feed cause they find it quite amusing and they know nothing will happen to them.

And they're idiots for thinking that as they *do* get punished by Riot for their actions, but only if they get reported (so one could assume this is you admitting you don't report them).

> There is a small amount of people on the OCE that are trying to do the right thing.

There is a small amount of people on OCE (compared to other servers, total OCE [or AUS or NZ] population, need I provide more examples?). Your point?

> **the majority of the people on this server** make that very very difficult...
> In nearly** 650 games**

Yes, because there are less than 11700 people on the OCE server, not only that but the majority of people in all the games you've played have made it very difficult, meaning your win rate should be something like 25%...

I could go on but I think I've made my point.
Actually pandas right, Nothing happens when you report people.

Now you've specified that reporting takes place to lead to the punishment on the individual who has been trying to do the right thing, thus backing up my statement.
Your sir are a gentleman and a scholar, and i applaud your logic, thank you for ruining this post so i didn't have to.
I skim read so missed that bit lol but yes I would say it is false riot doesn't do %%%%

Tribunal has been "in the works to be made more efficient" since OCE became a thing. reporting obviously does nothing. I will be physically in the same room as half my team when doing premades and we all report people that are causing problems yet nothing happens to them. Yes leave buster has been made better since the last two patches. The one support ticket that I sent in while I was on NA was ignored and several of my friends have had support tickets just not replied too. 

Yes the last couple of days as you stated in my match history I have not been coming across the same people but previously it has happened a lot. 

I report people who cause a fair amount of %%%%, I make sure too and as I said in my first paragraph, there have been several instances where I know the rest of the team has reported said person but nothing happens. 

I understand OCE is minuscule compared to any of the other servers and yes my win rate at the moment is %%%%

> [{quoted}](name=Pandapus OwO,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=KHZrbRVk,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2014-12-11T07:33:23.641+0000)
> Tribunal has been "in the works to be made more efficient" since OCE became a thing.

Check you facts mate. OCE became a thing in mid 2013, the tribunal was taken down by Riot earlier this year, in 2014, to be made more efficient. That's half a years difference minimum.

> **reporting obviously does nothing.** I will be physically in the same room as half my team when doing premades and we all report people that are causing problems yet **nothing happens to them.**

I'd really love to see some evidence supporting that statement. You will stop so many arguments if you manage to produce viable evidence.

> Yes leave buster has been made better since the last two patches.

So your statement about there being nothing to punish/ban people was false? Glad to know we agree.

> Yes the last couple of days as you stated in my match history I have not been coming across the same people but previously it has happened a lot. 

I wasn't being specific to the last couple days, I provided no time frame. I did bother checking back a while.

-sigh- 
I don't think it's worth anyone's time arguing over whether or not the current reporting system is effective. The underlying problem is that there are still a large number of people that are ruining games for others. Now, this clearly means that our current options aren't working.
Riot clearly needs to take a different approach in tackling these behaviors.

I'm not even sure whether or not it's possible for riot to really change the way people behave over the internet, yet alone in their game.  Maybe the best way to deal with this kind of thing is to develop some form of ingame monitoring system that might bring more threat to those with abusive behaviour in-game -well, it would certainly be a lot more effective than your average customer support rep from Riot .. (some of them make me sick) working on cases that might be days, even weeks ago.
